result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. April Marie Bubb

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on December 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:21 AM Defendant April Marie Bubb in court.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
950/Marsy's Law complied with. Def did not receive an offer yet. Court takes a short break. case recalled 10:32 State and Def met and reviewed offer. Def needs more time for a follow up before offer can be accepted.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

11:31 AM Defendant April Marie Bubb in court.  Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deft does not wish to have an Attorney. State has an offer for Deft. Deft will go down to DAS office to get the offer.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea hearing on October 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on October 5, 2022 at 10:45 am.

*NOT ON RECORD* Defendant April Marie Bubb not in court.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant did not appear for scheduling conference, State request to set STC in front of judge in person.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No violent or abusive contact with the party/parties named in the bail bond.

11:50 AM Prosecuting attorney Paul Christopher Dedinsky appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin. Given complaint-Advised of Rights-Bond set-Court enters not guilty plea on defts. behalf-950/Marsy's Law complied with. State makes request that if deft. completes AODA assessment and works with them they will plea down to ordinance violation.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.
